articles.title: Loh Kean Yew's giant-killing run ends at hands of Olympic badminton champion Viktor Axelsen - AsiaOne
articles.description: SINGAPORE - In the end, it was one giant too many for national shuttler Loh Kean Yew to overcome as he lost 21-13, 9-21, 21-13 to world No. 2 Viktor Axelsen in the final of the Indonesia Open on Sunday (Nov 28). Loh, the 24-year-old world No. 26, had beaten h…

articles.title: U.S. stock futures, oil regain some ground after Omicron battering - Reuters
articles.description: Asian markets regained a little composure on Monday as investors settled in for a few weeks of uncertainty on whether the Omicron variant would really derail economic recoveries and the tightening plans of some central banks.
articles.content: SYDNEY, Nov 29 (Reuters) - Asian markets regained a little composure on Monday as investors settled in for a few weeks of uncertainty on whether the Omicron variant would really derail economic recov… [+3541 chars]

articles.title: Chang Chen, Alyssa Chia win first Golden Horse acting awards after 30 years - AsiaOne
articles.description: TAIPEI - Taiwanese actor Chang Chen and actress Alyssa Chia have won their first Golden Horse Awards. Chia's film, The Falls, was the biggest victor with four wins at the 58th edition of the awards - considered the Oscars of the Chinese-language movie world -…
articles.content:

articles.title: Stocks, oil regain some composure after Omicron battering - Reuters
articles.description: Asian markets were trying to regain some composure on Monday as the spread of the Omicron variant in developed nations threatened to derail economic recoveries and the tightening plans of some central banks.
